defs: = ಜೀರಿಗೆರಾಜಾನ್ನ.
to cry aloud; to shout.
to scream.
to pull a rope at one end as to tighten the slipknot at the other end.
to scrape with claws or nails.
a thread passing between the strings and the bridge of a tambūri, (the base pitch instrument), used to vary the pitch subtly to tune it perfectly and to get sonorous sound.
(mus.) a note in the lower pitch, that is grave.
a kind of bee that makes continuous jarring sound.
a loop with a knot that slips along the rope or line around which it is made; a slipknot-loop.
to resonate with deep pitched tone.
to make a jarring sound, as some kinds of bees.
to raise (usu. in group) with a jīr sound.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
a device to eject liquid in a jet from a narrow orifice; a syringe; a squirt.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
= ಜೀರುಗುಣಿಕೆ.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
= ಜೀರ್ಕೊಳವೆ.
having lived or been in existence for a long time; aged; old; ancient.
feeble; enfeebled; weak.
reduced to or fallen into pieces or into disrepair, as from age, wear or neglect; dilapidated.
decayed; spoiled; rotten.
(said of food) digested; assimilated in the body.
the ripe age in one's life; old age.
an old man.
a being dissolved.
the act or process of (food) being digested, assimilated in the body.
that helps digestion (of food); digestive.
any substance or drink that aids digestion; a digestive.
the digestive organ of the body; the stomach.
a leaf that is fully grown and is about to fall down.
a fever that is persisting for long.
the last stage or years in a normal human life; old-age.
that which is old (esp. in a weak, feeble condition).
the intestinal juice or juices that help food digest and assimilate in the body.
any of the digestive organs of the body.
the condition of being dilapidated; dilapidation.
= ಜೀರ್ಣತನ.
to make or become worse; to lower in quality or value; to deteriorate; to decay.
to be digested (as food).
ಜೀರ್ಣಿಸಿಕೊಳ್ಳು jīrṇisikoḷḷu to get digested (food eaten); 2. to understand thoroughly; 3. to swindle (others or public) money and get away with it.
to cause (food) to be digested.
the act of bringing something (as dilapidated building) back to its original or near original stage, by repairing, reconstructing, etc.
a jarring sound (as of some kind of bees).
the act or an instance of deceiving; a being deceived.
a kind of bird .
the creeper Momordica balsamina of Cucurbitaceae family.
its fruit.
having life; not dead; live.
a living being.

an entity which is regarded as a) being the principle of life; b) the immortal or spiritual part of the person; and c) a distinct entity separate from the body, and is credited with the functions of thinking and willing, and hence determining all behaviour; the soul.
the duration of life or the state of possessing life.
Břhaspati, the preceptor of gods.
the sound uttered by human beings; speech.
water.
a horse.
the string of a bow.
the means of sustaining life; livelihood; a living.
(astrol.) the Planet Jupiter.
(fig.) that which is much loved by a person; the dearest person or thing.

ಜೀವಕ್ಕೆ ಜೀರಿಗೆಯೆರೆ jīvakke jīrigeyere to trouble, torment (a person); ಜೀವದೊರಿಸೆ jīvadorise being alive; ಜೀವಭಯ jīva bhaya the fear of being killed; ಜೀವ ಹಿಡಿ jīva hiḍi to be alive; 2. to wait or tolerate patiently; ಜೀವ ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡಿರು jīva iṭṭukoṇḍiru to be alive; 2. to have excessive love, affection on; ಜೀವ ಎಳೆ jīva eḷe (one's disposition) to be strongly in favour of; ಜೀವ ಜಾಲಾಡು jīva jālāḍu to rebuke strongly and severely; ಜೀವಕ್ಕೆ ಬರು jīvakke baru (fig.) (a very difficult situation) to arise; ಜೀವ ಬರು jīva baru (fig.) (anxiety, fright) to be removed, cleared; ಜೀವ ಬಿಡು jīva biḍu (fig.) to show or have excessive love or affection; ಜೀವ ಭೂಮಿಗೆ ಇಳಿದು ಹೋಗು jīva bhūmige iḷidu hōgu (fig.) to lose heart; to lose courage.
to deprive of courage or enthusiasm; to cause to be depressed or frightened.
a dove, pigeon.
the bird Perdix rufus fabled to subsist upon moon-beams; Greek partridge.
= ಜೀವಂಜೀವ.
living; alive.
active; functioning.
the fact of being alive.
a man who is alive.
being or having life.
a kind of potherb of Amaranthaceae family.
a seasoning of foods by adding spices fried in a ladle.
to make vigorous or active; invigorate; to enliven.
= ಜೀವಂತಿಕೆ.
= ಜೀವಂತಿಕೆ.
an individual who, being present, has personally witnessed a thing; an eye-witness.
the plant Coleogyne ovalis of Orchidaceae family.
the plant Dendrobium macraei of Orchidaceae family.
the quality or fact of being lively; liveliness.
the plant Vanda tessellata (= V. roxburghii, = Epidendrum tesseloides) of Orchidaceae family.
to get renewed energy in life; to be enliven.
being alive.
having the quality of life.
to make vigorous or active; invigorate; to enliven.
that is living; alive; not dead or lifeless.
helping to earn livelihood; life-supporting.
a menial servant.
a snake charmer.
a Jaina mendicant.
the tree Calophyllum inophyllum (= C. apetalum, = C. spurium) of Guttiferae family (?).
a kind of medicinal herb.
a man who subsists on the interest earned on the money lent.

(Biol.) a very small, complex unit of protoplasm, usu. with a nucleus, cytoplasm, and an enclosing membrane, (all plants and animals are made up of one or more cells that usu. combine to form various tissues); a cell.
the tree Plumeria rubra (= p. acuminata, = P. acutifolia) of Apocynaceae family, with large and fragrant flowers; frangipani.
its flower.
the art which enhances the beauty of life.
the spirit of life as vitality, bodily strength, vigour, energy, ability, etc.
= ಜೀವಕಲೆ.
to cause to have vitality, bodily strength, vigour energy, liveliness, etc.
the duration of a person's life; lifetime.
the plant Terminalia chebula of Combrefaceae family.
its astringent fruit; myrobalan.
to give life; to cause to come back to life.
to sacrifice one's life for another or for a cause.
all the living beings collectively.

a small, usu. microscopic mass of protoplasm bounded externally by a semi permeable membrane, usu. including one or more nuclei and various other organelles with their products, capable alone or interacting with other cells of performing all the fundamental functions of life, and forming the smallest structural unit of living matter capable of functioning independently; a cell.
the natural bodily functions in a living being.
= ಜೀವಕ2.
a man who lacks courage in facing danger, difficulty, opposition, pain, etc.; a coward.
the nature or the basic properties of the soul.
the quality of being full of life; liveliness; the condition of having full or suggestive of life or vital energy.
(astrol.) either of two zodiac houses Sagittarius or Pisces, supposed to be the own houses of the planet Jupiter.
to get, regain liveliness, vital energy, etc.
the part of the earth's crust, waters, and atmosphere, extending from the deep crust to the lower atmosphere, that supports life; the biosphere.
a capturing of a person (as a thief, bandit, dacoit, etc.) alive.
one of the five mystic hymns.
a killing living being.
the life-cycle of living beings; bio-cycle.
all the living beings collectively.
the personified vital energy of life.
a person lacking positive qualities of life, as of warmth, vitality, interest, brightness, brilliance, etc. (considered as dead despite being alive).
that which is born from another living being.
that which is born in water, as lotus plant and other water plants.
= ಜೀವಚಯ.
that which is born in water, as lotus plant, and other water plants.
the vitality or principle of life.
the small-sized, evergreen tree Guaiacum officinale of Zygophyllaceae family, with blue or purple flowers and fruit growing in capsules; Guaiacum tree; Lignum vitae.
to infuse life, enthusiasm, vitality, vigour into a person.
to kill (a living being).
(fig.) to cause great physical pain or mental anguish in; to torment, to torture.
to work very hard (for).
= ಜೀವತ್ತೋಕೆ.
a woman whose child is or children are alive.
a woman whose husband is alive.
a man whose father is alive.
a dying voluntarily; sacrifice of one's life.
the quality, state of the soul.
the state or quality of being alive.
compassion for or kindness shown to, all the living beings.
a man who gives life, protects another from death or great danger or peril.
a woman who gives life.
she who protects another from death or great danger or peril.
a giving of life; a rescuing from great danger or peril.
a remitting from death penalty.
a sustenance provided.
(cricket) a missing of a chance of getting a batsman out, as by dropping a catch.
the tree Erythroxylon monogynum of Erythroxylaceae family; red cedar.
a language that is being currently used by common people; a language that is not obsolete.
the elementary substance of life.
the cattle, sheep, and other useful animals kept or raised on a farm or ranch, considered as one's wealth.
a woman who protects (other's) lives (chiefly referred to the earth, personified as the mother of all living beings).
a kind of plant .
the fact of living or continuing to be alive.
the source for being lively, vigorous, enthusiastic, etc.; the force that makes or keeps something alive; the vivifying or quickening principle.
the state or fact of existing; existence of a living being.
the general or universal condition of human existence; life.
the period of existence of a living being.
the course of existence or sum of experiences and actions that constitute a person's existence.
a mode or manner of existence, as in the world of affairs or society.
a means of supporting one's existence, esp. financially or vocationally; livelihood.
the act of makeing the life of a person active, vigorous or lively; a filling with life and energy; invigoration.
water.
a man who invigorates (another).
a written account of one's life (either written by oneself or another); biography.
any of water-born plants, esp. lotus plant.
a flower of such a plant, esp. of lotus.
a principle one has adopted in one's life; principle of one's life.
the rational investigation of the truths and principles of life (of human beings) with particular reference to human qualities as kindness, compassion, moral standards, etc.; the philosophy of life.
a man who gives life.
he who protects another from death or great danger or peril.
he who fills with life and energy; an invigorator.
a woman who gives life.
she who protects another from death or great danger or peril.
she who fills with life and energy; an invigorator.
a river in which water flows during all the seasons; a river that never dries; a perennial river.

the duration of a person's life; lifetime.
a grade or level of subsistence and comfort in everyday life enjoyed by a community, class or individual; the standard of living.
a device to eject liquid in a jet from a narrow orifice; a syringe; a squirt.
the earning of one's livelihood.
the practical or worldly life of a person, including all the circumstances, experiences, etc.
any of the water birds.
a cloud that carries water.
the process of gradual, progressive change or development in one's life.
a wage that is barely sufficient for one's or sustenance or the sustenance of one's family with minimum customary standards; living-wage.
a woman with positive outlook in life being enthusiastic, lively and also being a source of such qualities for others.

any of a group of organic substances essential in small quantities to normal metabolism, found in minute amounts in natural foodstuffs or sometimes produced synthetically: deficiencies of vitamins produce specific disorders; a vitamin.
a shed on the roadside in which water, butter-milk etc. are distributed gratis.
a means of support or sustenance that one has to provide or has provided another with, for life; a life-annuity; maintenance.
any of the important veins of the body.
(fig.) the main or an important source of support or sustenance.
the earning of one's livelihood.
a means of support legally provided by one to another.
an ultimate object or aim of endeavour, esp. one of high or noble character, in one's life; the ideal of one's life.

the plant Coleogyne ovalis of Orchidaceae family.
the ocean.
aiding longevity.
water.

a person who is concerned only about earning the livelihood.
any life-saving drug.
a man who has attained liberation from the worldly bonds and from future births, by acquiring true spiritual knowledge, while still alive.
liberation of a person from future births, all ritual acts, got by acquiring the true self-knowledge.
a man lacking positive qualities of life, as of warmth, vitality, interest, brightness, brilliance, etc. (considered as dead despite being alive).

a woman lacking positive qualities of life, as of warmth, vitality, interest, brightness, brilliance, etc. (considered as dead despite being alive).
(Dvaita phil.) the five classes of living beings - being gods, Gandharvas, one's dead ancestors (supposed to be living in other worlds), human beings, and demons.
a bright-green, transparent precious stone, a green variety of beryl, which is valued as a gem; emerald.
to get, regain life.
to regain one's strength, liveliness in life.
a woman whose husband is alive.
(Jain.) the soul considered as a substance; the life-principle.
a courageous, valiant man.

= ಜೀವಧಾನಿ.
the state or quality of the soul.
a person who has positive attitude in living (a purposeful life).
(phil.) the illusion, caused by ignorance, of considering one's self is different from the Supreme Soul, though it is not so, in fact.

the duration of the existence of a living being; life-time.
a defensive covering, usu. of metal, formerly worn by soldiers to protect the body in fighting; a body-armour.
(fig.) the blood, considered as essential to maintain life; lifeblood.

protection or guarding of anothers' life.
a kind of medicinal herb.
a very precious gem.
(Jain.) one of the seven divine means an emperor gets by providence.
life, as most precious one.
any fluid vital to the life or health of an organism; sap.
all the living beings collectively.
full of life; lively; sprightly; vivacious; active; energetic.
the state of being alive; life.
a man who lacks courage in facing danger, difficulty, opposition, pain, etc.; a coward.
a slaying of a living being.
to kill a living being.
a speech that conveys one's positive approach to the life.
the fifth day of the week; Thursday.
a person who, lacking true knowledge of the self, is subject to the illusions of earthly life.
the development of a species organism or organ from its original or primitive state to its present or specialised state; phylogeny or ontogeny; evolution of life.

the theory of evolution, propounded by Charles Robert Darwin (1809-82), which holds that all species of plants and animals developed from earlier forms by hereditary transmission of slight variations in successive generations, and that natural selection determines which forms will survive.
the science that deals with the origin, history, physical characteristics, life processes, habits, etc. of plants and animals; biology.

insurance providing for payment of a sum of money to a named beneficiary upon the death of the policyholder or to the policyholder if still living after reaching a specified age or on completion of specified period; life-insurance.
a slaying of a living being.

a big conch that produce a heavy sound when blown.
= ಜೀವವಿಜ್ಞಾನ.

without life; lifeless - a) that never had life; inanimate b) that no longer has life; dead c) having no living beings; d) dull; listless; lacking positive qualities, as of warmth, vitality, interest, brightness, brilliance, etc.
= ಜೀವನ್ಮತ.
= ಜೀವರಾಶಿ.
= ಜೀವರಾಶಿ.
a dearest friend.

any of a group of organic substances essential in small quantities to normal metabolism, found in minute amounts in natural foodstuffs or sometimes produced synthetically, deficiencies of which produce specific disorders; a vitamin.

a being buried alive.
a burrying alive (of a person or animal).

= ಜೀವರಾಶಿ.
the soul as a witness of one's deeds.
(Jain.) an establishing of the reality of the soul convincingly and conclusively.
a place or part where two bones or corresponding structures are joined, usu. in a manner that enables them move.
a vital or vulnerable part of the body.
the positive attitude, enthusiasm that makes the life lively.
a remembering of important events of one's past life.
a report or record of such events.
a slaying of a living being or beings.
loss of life or lives.

a kind of .

the end of life; death.

a man who kills or treats others or animals brutally.
the act or an instance of taking out the soul; a killing of a living being.

any of the syllables from 'ಅ to ಔ' in Kannaḍa alphabet, pronounced with a sound characterised by generalised friction of the air passing in a continuous stream through the pharynx and opened mouth but with no constriction narrow enough to produce local friction; a vowel.
(Jain.) transmigration of the soul into another body at or after death.
(phil.) ignorance as the cause of illusion in life.

(Biol.) a very small, complex unit of protoplasm, usu. with a nucleus, cytoplasm, and an enclosing membrane, (all plants and animals are made up of one or more cells that usu. combine to form various tissues); a cell.

(rightly ಅಣುಜೀವಿ) any of the microscopic, one-celled creatures, having no chlorophyll, multiplying by simple division, some of which cause diseases such as pneumonia and anthrax, while some others are necessary for fermentation, nitrogen fixation, etc.; a bacterium.
= ಜೀವಸತ್ವ.
the state or fact of existing or period of existence of a living being; life.
food that is required for growth and sustenance of a living being.
any life-saving drug.
= ಜೀವಾತ್ಮ.

an entity which is regarded as a) being the principle of life, b) the immortal or spiritual part of the person and, c) a distinct entity separate from the body, and is credited with the functions of thinking and willing, and hence determining all behaviour; the soul.
any that that enables a person live; a life support.
the part of the earth's crust, waters, and atmosphere, extending from the deep crust to the lower atmosphere, that supports life; the biosphere.
a feeling of deep sympathy, compassion or commiseration for another or any living being in gen., that is stricken by misfortune, accompanied by a strong desire to alleviate the suffering.
a person having compassion, sympathy or commiseration for another or any living being in gen.
a killing of a person.
a man having desire to continue to live.
the time that the life of someone or something continues; the term of a life.
a sentence of imprisonment for the rest of one's life.
having life; not dead; live.
that which or a person who gives life-support.
that which makes something what it is; intrinsic, fundamental nature or most important quality (of something); essential being; essence.
the significance or the main theme.
a thread passing between the strings and the bridge of a tambu`ri, (the base pitch instrument), used to vary the pitch subtly to tune it perfectly and get a sonorous sound.
the least degree of variation in the pitch of the sound, which human ear can perceive, made by such adjustment.
ಜೀವಾಳಕಟ್ಟು jīvāḷa kaṭṭu to tune or adjust the pitch of a tambūri with the help a thread, as to get sonorous sound.
being alive; living.
a living being.
the ficus tree Ficus benjamina (= F. retusa) of Moraceae family; the java fig tree.
the first embryonic stage or growth or development.
the state or fact of existing or period of existence of a living being; life.
an occupation, profession taken by a person for getting his or her livelihood.
lived; existed; that was existing.
having life; living; alive.
a principle or force that is considered to underlie the distinctive quality of animate beings; life.
the fact of being alive or mode, duration of one's living.
means of support; subsistence; sustenance.
a fixed compensation paid periodically to a person for regular work or services; salary.
to get or earn compensation for one's regular work or services; to get salary.
the duration of one's life; life-time.
a man working regularly for another and who gets salary for it; a salaried man.
the ending of one's life.
the lord of one's life.
a man as related to a woman whom he has married; a husband.
Yama, the God of Death and Righteousness.

a woman as related to the man whom she is married to; wife.
the natural or biological tendency, trait, characteristic of a living being.
the act of making something free from living micro organisms as by subjecting to great heat or chemical action; sterilisation.
to be alive; to have life.
to pass one's life in a specified manner.
to maintain life; to support oneself.
the fact of being alive; a living.
to taper or sharpen one end of a writing-pencil.
the removal of living tissue from the body for diagnostic examination; biopsy.
a specimen obtained from a biopsy.
life - a) the state or fact of existing; existence of a living being; b) the course of existence or sum of experiences and actions that constitute a person's existence.
the string of a bow.
desire of abandoning or giving up.
to cry aloud; to shout.
to scream in a shrill voice.

the screaming sound; shrill cry.

a kind of bee that makes continuous jarring sound.
to raise (usu. in group) with a ಜೀಱ್ sound.
ಜೀಱೇಳು.
the state of the mind, caused by excess joy, awe, fear, ghastliness, etc. characterised by light but continuous vibration of the body with the hairs being erect.
the sensation created in the body by uncomfortable coldness.
a painful feeling caused by cold or hot drink or eatable in the jaw where the tooth is or teeth are damaged.
the pain of a wound.
a kind of percussion instrument.
the weed Argyreia nervosa (= A. speciosa) of Convolvulaceae family; elephant creeper.
to engage in a physical struggle, pulling vehemently each other.
to pull with force (repeatedly, as in quarrelling).
fibre of the husks of some plants, esp. of coconuts.
the hair at the lower part of the abdomen surrounding the external genitals; pubes.

(the mind) to reel under fear; to be frightened.
the hair growing on the body, esp. on the head.
a lock of hair growing just above the forehead; forelock.
rough tuft of hair.
a continuous, light rain; drizzling.
uncombed hair.
curled hair.

a kind of water pipe with a long flexible tube for drawing the smoke through water in a vase or bowl and cooling it; a narghile; a hookah.

the behaviour, manners of an individual.

any of the four mythological division of period of time each extending to several thousand years.

causing aversion, abhorrence; disgusting; abhorrent; detestable.
that causes, causing aversion, abhorrence; disgusting; abhorrent; detestable.
a strong distaste; nausea; loathing; disgust; abhorrence.

to be stingy or deal in a miserly manner.
to quibble in bargaining; to palter.
to hold oneself back, as from shame, shyness or lack of confidence.

the quality of giving or spending grudgingly or only through necessity; stinginess; miserliness.

small in amount, degree, etc.: 2.of little importance, influence, etc.; trivial.

ಜುಟ್ಟನ್ನು ಕೈಯಲ್ಲಿ ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡಿರು juṭṭannukaiyally iṭṭukoṇḍiru to keep another under one's control.

the knot of a bunch of hair (tied on or back of the head).

a hammer with a head on one side for driving nails, and a curved, split end on the other to remove the driven nails.
a low, woody plant with several permanent stems instead of a single trunk; a bush; a shrub.
a tuft of hair, threads, etc.
a kind of agreeably pungent, liquid food made using the flour of the dried dhal of Cicer arietinum (chicken pea), to be mixed with rice.
